Public Law.definition: an enactment of a legislature that affects the public at large throughout the entire territory

1.definition: an enactment of a legislature that affects the public at large throughout the entire territory (as a state or nation) which is subject to the jurisdiction of the legislature or within a particular subdivision of its jurisdictioncalled alsocompare

2 a.definition: the area of law that deals with the relations of individuals with the state and regulates the organization and conduct of government compare

sub_terms.b: international law regulating the relations among sovereign states or nations as distinguished from private international law
